summary: An email from Assistant United States Attorney Maurene Comey to an expert witness, Dr. Cooper, regarding potential testimony in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial scheduled for July 12, 2020. The email is a request to schedule a call to discuss Dr. Cooper's involvement.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, reaching out to schedule a call with Dr. Cooper about potential testimony at trial.

persons.name: Dr. Cooper
persons.context: Potential expert witness whom prosecutors wish to speak with about testifying at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is scheduled for trial.

connections.description: Prosecutor contacting a potential expert witness to discuss testifying at trial.
Prosecutor working on the case against the defendant.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on this date in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Prosecutor Reaches Out to Expert Witness
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey emails to schedule a call with Dr. Cooper about potentially testifying at the Maxwell trial.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were actively preparing for trial as of October 2020, seeking expert witnesses.
The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for July 12, 2020, in the Southern District of New York.
Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey was a prosecutor on the case, contacting potential witness Dr. Cooper.
